Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have left Dunder-Mifflin after many record-breaking years and am officially on the job market. And it's very exciting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For your convenience, I've broken it down into three parts: professional resume, athletic and special skills resume, and Dwight Schrute trivia.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am ready to face any challenges that might be foolish enough to face me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How would I describe myself? Three words. Hard-working, Alpha male, Jackhammer, Merciless, Insatiable.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is nothing on my horizon except everything. Everything is on my horizon.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Staples uniform] I got this job to make some money while I continue my employment search. And uh, it's fine for the time being. Oops. Break's over.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Big Turkey. [cellphone plays "Rockin' Robin"]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that you singing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All four parts. Recorded it on my computer. It took me forever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you muchly. [cellphone continues playing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gonna answer it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I called it myself. I just thought you'd get a kick out of the new ring.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Side note. I'd just like to say I'm thrilled to be working directly beneath you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I feel I have a lot to learn from you, even though you're younger and have less experience. So here's to the future... Andy and the Tuna. [sings] Andy and the tuna...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I miss Dwight. Congratulations, universe. You win.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, Dwight Schrute has left this company. More personnel turnover.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The cost of doing business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, well. It is a big loss. Dwight was the top salesman...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Was the top salesman...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I said 'was'.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [chuckles] Addition by subtraction.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What does that even mean? That is impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmmm. Yeah you're right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But, there is some good news. Oscar is back. Addition by addition. So we are going to have a big party today to welcome him back and hopefully that will lift everybody's spirits.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, hello, Oscar. How was your gay-cation?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, that's very funny.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah? I thought of it like, two seconds after you left.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [sits at his desk] Hi, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what's up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Noooothin'. Ehrrrrrrrrr. Heh. Man. TGI-Wednesday. Am I right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gonna go home. Get my beer on. Get my "Lost" on. What are you doing later, wanna hang out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I will take that as a maybe. [Michael gets up] Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, well, I'm going to the kitchen, I'll walk with you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [lurking by the bathroom door] Yeah, things are going pretty good. Gettin' a lot of face time with the boss.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar? I have a question. Would you like to join the party planning committee?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The one of all women?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Because I'm gay?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No. Certain events have transpired. And I've thought about certain things. And I'm sorry for the way those certain events transpired. [starts to cry] And I would just like to make some changes about certain things and certain situations.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: OK, OK, OK, all right, all right. I'll join. I'd love to. That's -- thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. [sniffles]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Can I join too?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Never.

Quote.Speaker: Staples Guy
Quote.Text: You sell those two printers this morning? Nice work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Child's play. Give me something hard to sell.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. [walks over to the plant] What is wrong with this thing? It looks terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you want me to ask the cleaning crew if they stopped watering it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. And you know what? Ask them about the toys on my desk too. They always used to arrange them in a very pleasing way. It used to brighten my morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, that wasn't the night crew. That was Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? That was very nice of him. We need more attitude like that around the office.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Feel ya, dawg.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, do you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What did I say?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You said... [makes gibberish noises]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which is like, "Right on." And Pam was like "blah blah blah" and you were like "Yeah, psht." Nailed it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Love that Andy, right? Solid fellow. Seems smart enough. Likes me a lot. A lot. Too much. Like a crazy person. A little. Not super crazy... just... there's something about him that creeps me out. I can't really explain it. He's always up in my bidness. Which is ebonics for "being in my face and annoying the bejesus out of me." I don't understand how someone could have so little self-awareness.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I really have no preference. We don't even have to have a party.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, hey, hey. Don't be ridiculous. Of course we are going to have a party. A celebration of Oscar. Oscar night. And I want it to be Oscar-specific.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. I mean, not because you're gay. Your gayness does not define you. Your Mexican-ness is what defines you to me. And I think we should celebrate Oscar's Mexicanity. So Phyllis... I want you to go find firecrackers. And a Chihuahua. Pam, in the frozen food section, Swanson makes a delightful chimichanga.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why don't you have me riding in on a donkey into the office like Pepe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, a burro, of course. If Oscar wants a donkey, let's get him one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Need any help?

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: Oh, no, thank you. I'm just looking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great. I will literally be standing right here if you need anything at all.

Quote.Speaker: Lady
Quote.Text: Okay. [moves away]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I think I could go for some tuna fish right about now. Oh, oh, got my rod here. [fake casts off] Whizzzzz. [catches Jim] Click, click, click, click, click, click, click. [Jim gets up] Cli -- ah! I got one! I got one! Ahhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So Andy is in rare form today.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yeah, you should not encourage him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Encourage him? I'm the victim, okay? He's fishing for me. We've got to do something.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Look, I've got like fifteen new clients I inherited from Dwight and each file is password protected with a different mythical creature. So, I'm sorry. I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fine. Party pooper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's that sportscaster that bit that lady? Marv something? Andy is like Marv Something. Great sportscaster. Big weirdo creep.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 185 pounder. Check it out. Whew! ["displays" Jim who looks thoroughly annoyed]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You wanna pull a prank on Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Not right now, but ask me again ten years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I liked you better when you were the temp.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey guys. How's the workload on all of Dwight's old accounts? Handling it okay?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sort of. He had a lot of clients.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, he did. Have any of you talked to Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, sure, we talk all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't - don't do that. That's not nice. What about you, Phyllis? You and Dwight were close.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Dwight has a big personality and I have a big personality. And a lot of times when two people like that get together it can be explosive.

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: Really comin' down out there. Commute's gonna be hell.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have snow tires and chains. Plus exceptional hand-eye coordination.

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: So um, where were you workin' before this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: What kind of company is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Paper company. They're only one of Staples' top competitors in the area.

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: I never heard of 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa. Really? Have you heard of paper?

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: You gonna be like that, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Paris
Quote.Text: I don't like him, his giant head, or his beady little eyes. That's all I got to say on the matter.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] In your he-ead, in your he-eyd-ed. Zombie. Zombie. Zombie. Ey, ey, ey, ey. In your he-eyd-ed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would you like to pull a prank on Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm kind of in the middle of -- yes please.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, good. Stay right here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [after Jim knocks over his pencils] Oh. Good move, Tuna. Nice one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hands Pam Andy's phone] Are there any messages?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So weird.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [takes the phone] Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice to have Oscar back.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Large Tuna. Have you seen my cell phone device?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cause someone is calling right now. There is a call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh. [hands Pam tape]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where is my FREAKING phone?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Maybe it's in the ceiling.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Maybe you're in the ceiling!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [trying to look in Phyllis's desk, she slams the drawer shut] I don't trust you, Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wanted to let you know that Dwight was late that morning because he was driving to New York to drop off the correlated documents that I forgot to send. Though to be fair, Kevin never reminded me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why would Dwight do that for you? I think I know why. Because Dwight loves this company.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think that anyone else out there would have driven to corporate for you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: None of them. Especially not Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, I have a mission to accomplish. Make sure this party gets rolling and I will be back shortly.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait up. Where are you going? Do you want me to come with?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just listen, I forgot to tell you the plan for this Saturday. You, me, bars, beers, buzzed. Wings. Shots. Drunk. Waitresses, hot. Football - Cornell/Hofstra. Slaughter. Then a quick nap at my place and we'll hit the tiz-own.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I don't want to do any of that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Duh. Which is why I was just joking about doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just stop. Stop. Stop doing it. You're going to drive me crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Fine. I'll just sit at my desk and be quiet. Sorry I annoyed you with my friendship. [Andy's phone rings] Excuse me. And I'm also sorry that a lot of people here for some reason think it's funny to steal someone's personal property and hide it from them. Here's a little newsflash! It's not funny! In fact, it's pretty freakin' unfunny! Oh, my GOD. [punches a hole in the wall] That... was an overreaction. Gonna hit the break room. Does anybody want anything? Pam, you good?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure? Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to customer] Well, that question is meaningless. Just go with the copy paper. It's your funeral. See how that works out for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Same old.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um. It takes a big man to admit his mistake. And I am that big man. Angela from accounting told me what you did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my God, she told you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, she did. And Dwight, if you were willing to do something like that for some random co-worker, then clearly I have misjudged you from the beginning, and I apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Accepted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How's this place treating you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] The boss isn't funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, well.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't get to wear my ties.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I'm sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, maybe you should come back. You should come back. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't want to do your laundry anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We can talk about that. [Dwight high fives Michael] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [inspecting the hole in the wall] Oh my God, that's half-inch drywall.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think we broke his brain. [they both snicker]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [imitating Andy] "It's not freakin' funny!"

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you enjoying your fiesta?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, yeah. I didn't think I would, but turns out -- [Angela walks away] it's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen! May I present... Mr. Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Everybody
Quote.Text: Yay. [scattered appalause]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Welcome back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight, you can let go of her hand. You're gonna break it. [looks around the room] Not bad, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did this for me? [camera pans to "Welcome Back Oscar" sign]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guilty.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh... Where did you get this stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Gerty's.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Which aisle?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't remember.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well, draw me a map, mama.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam. I will shake mine and then you will shake yours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I will not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So does this remind you of your childhood right now?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It reminds me a lot of the 'Three Amigos' with Steve Martin and Chevy Chase.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Thank you. Wow, that's- thanks so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [sighs] Do you still have feelings for her?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [long pause and then he sighs and nods] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And now, ladies and gentlemen, the big finale! Sir, would you do the honor? [hands broom to Dwight, though Oscar thinks he's handing it to him]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, man. [Kevin starts to put a blindfold on] No, no, no. I don't need it. Get out! [beats up pinata]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It takes a big man to admit his mistake and that's what I did. The important thing is I learned something. I don't want somebody sucking up to me because they think I'm going to help their career. I want them sucking up to me because they genuinely love me. Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So Michael had a little chat with corporate and they decided to send me to management training. Anger management, technically, but still. Management material. [gets out of his car] This whole thing supposed to take ten weeks, but I can be done in five. How? Name repetition, personality mirroring, and positive reinforcement through nods and smiles. So, don't worry about old Andy Bernard. I'll be back. Just like Rambo, so.

Quote.Speaker: Marcy
Quote.Text: Oh, hi. You must be Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, hi! Yes. I am and you must be... Marcy!

Quote.Speaker: Marcy
Quote.Text: That's right, it's so good to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's so good to meet you!

Quote.Speaker: Marcy
Quote.Text: Thanks. Well, you ready to have some fun?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.
